info.title: SuperOffice Agent API v1
info.termsOfService: You must be an authorized user to access this API.

post.summary: Loading default values into a new EmailFlow.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.EmailFlow.description:
Email flow carrier
<para />
Carrier object for EmailFlow.
Services for the EmailFlow Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

JumpToFinish.description: When a goal is reached, contact jumps directly to finished

StartOnlyOnce.description: A contact can start this flow only once

ReplyToAddr.description: Reply to address, if different from From-address

UseTimeframe.description: Use sender timeframe settings, only send email/sms within the timeframe

SelectedDays.description: Selected days (flags, so several days can be selected) for time frame

TimeframeStart.description: Start of email/sms sending timeframe in [DT: ] format, interpreted in workflow time zone

TimeframeEnd.description: End of email/sms sending timeframe in [DT: ] format, interpreted in workflow time zone

UseWorkflowStart.description: Start the flow running with enrolled participants at the given time

WorkflowStart.description: When to start running the workflow. Until start, any enrolled members are not running through the flow, just waiting. In [DT: ] format, interpreted in workflow time zone

UseEnrollmentEnd.description: End enrollment into the workflow at the given time

EnrollmentEnd.description: Do not enroll more participant after given time. In [DT: ] format, interpreted in workflow time zone

RemoveFromFlows.description: Workflows to remove the participants from when they are enrolled in this workflow

Folder.description:
The folder/hierarchy the email flow is in. 
<para>Use MDO List name "hierarchy" to get list items.</para>

Associate.description:
The owner of the workflow. 
<para>Use MDO List name "associate" to get list items.</para>

Steps.description: The steps in the workflow, mainline steps - forking steps are indicated by its WorkflowStepType.

BlockLists.description: Persons in the given selections are not allowed to enter this workflow

ContentInfo.description: Info about workflow content like messages, links and forms (read-only)

ExitFlowId.description: On exit with no success criteria met, we attempt to add the participant to the given flow

ExitSuccessFlowId.description: On exit with success criteria met, we attempt to add the participant to the given flow

CreatedBy.description: The associate that first created the flow. The property is read-only.

UpdatedBy.description: The person that last updated the flow.

VisibleFor.description: The set of users or groups the record is visible for

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

Name.description: Name associated with the location: Country name + region name, Norway, United States - Alaska

TZLocationCode.description:
Code associated with location: UTC, AR-NQ, AU-QLD, PF2A
Not the an ISO country code. Unique.

TZLocationCities.description: Cities associated with location: Oslo, London, Rio de Janeiro

IsoNumber.description: Country ISO code associated with location: 578

TimeZoneDSTRules.description: Dictionary of Daylight saving time rules

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.HierarchyEntity.description:
Folder structures
<para />
Carrier object for HierarchyEntity.
Services for the HierarchyEntity Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IListAgent">List Agent</see>.

Fullname.description: The full name of this category, i.e. Foo/bar/test.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.TableRight.description:
Wraps a table right together with an explanatory reason.
Code can indicate why access is restricted.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldProperty.description: Class holding properties like field length, field type about a field in the carrier.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldRight.description:
Wraps the field right together with an explanatory reason.
Also adds logical operators to the field rights so that they can be easily combined.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Associate.description:
Carrier object for Associate.
Services for the Associate Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IAssociateAgent">Associate Agent</see>.

Name.description: Initials, also login name, possibly database user name

PersonId.description:
Owning person record 
<para>Use MDO List name "person" to get list items.</para>

Type.description: User type - 1 = internal user, 2 = resource, 3 = external user, 4 = anonymous, 5 = system

GroupIdx.description: Primary group membership, see UserGroupLink for secondary memberships

FullName.description: The associate's culture formatted fullname (firstname, middleName and lastname)

FormalName.description: The associate's culture formatted formalname (firstname, middleName and lastname, title, mrmrs)

Deleted.description: If true, the user is retired and should have no rights, not appear in lists, etc.

EjUserId.description: ID of the ej user record corresponding to this associate; 0 for associates that are not ej users

ExtraFields.description:
Deprecated: Use {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Associate.CustomFields} instead.
Extra fields added to the carrier. This could be data from Plug-ins, the foreign key system, external applications, etc.

CustomFields.description:
Udef + Extra fields added to the carrier. Extra fields as defined by changes to database schema + user-defined fields as defined by admin.
Custom fields combines user defined fields and extra fields into one bucket. 
The individual {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Associate.ExtraFields} and <see cref="!:UserDefinedFields">UserDefinedFields</see> properties are deprecated in favor of this
combined collection.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.MDOListItem.description:
Carrier object for MDOListItem.
Services for the MDOListItem Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IMDOAgent">MDO Agent</see>.

Deleted.description: The deleted status of the ListItem

Type.description: The type of the ListItem. Custom field.

ChildItems.description: The child items of the MDOListItem

IconHint.description: The Icon hint of the ListItem. Custom field.

ColorBlock.description: The color indicator of the ListItem color block

ExtraInfo.description: Extra information added to the ListItem. Could be information such as sort order etc or other meta data. Custom field.

StyleHint.description: Style hint indicating, information such as background color etc. Custom field.

FullName.description: The name of the ListItem in its context

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.WorkflowStepBas.description:
Workflow step carrier.
<para />
Carrier object for WorkflowStepBase.
Services for the WorkflowStepBase Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.WorkflowTrigger.description:
Workflow trigger carrier
<para />
Carrier object for WorkflowTrigger.
Services for the WorkflowTrigger Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

WorkflowId.description: The flow this trigger belongs to

RestrictionGroups.description: The restrictions (can be multiple groups) that make up the Workflow trigger criteria

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.ArchiveLists.ArchiveRest.description: This class carries information about a group of restrictions
This class carries information about a restriction on the query of an archive provider

Name.description: The programmatic column name, including any required prefixes

DisplayValues.description:
Display representation of value(s) - list ID's are decoded to display texts, other values are represented in a format
suitable for decoding and display through the {SuperOffice.CRM.Globalization.CultureDataFormatter}.

ColumnInfo.description: Optional complete ArchiveColumnInfo for this restriction; in that case, ColumnInfo.Name == this.Name will always be true

IsActive.description: Is this restriction active?  Inactive restrictions will not influence the generated query

SubRestrictions.description: Optional collection of sub criteria, usually null but set for Saint counter fields

InterParenthesis.description:
Get or set the parenthesis (if any) associated with this restriction. Positive values indicate a number
of opening parentheses (deepening nesting level), while negative numbers indicate closing parentheses.
Zero means no change in nesting level (no parentheses).

InterOperator.description:
Get or set the inter-restriction operator that describes how this
restriction is related to the next one in an array.
Default for new ArchiveRestrictionInfo objects is And

SuperOffice.CRM.ArchiveLists.ArchiveColu.description:
This class carries information about the definition and properties of an archive display column. It is used by the archive
MDO providers to construct column lists for the configuration dialogs, and by the archive control to know what type
(and other properties) each column has. The class is serializable and used on both the application
and Web server sides.

DisplayName.description: The column name to show, can be a resource identifier string

DisplayTooltip.description: The column tooltip, used in the column list and in the column headings

DisplayType.description:
Type of column, so that the archive knows how to display it (actual display values are always strings, invariant-culture formatted).
This name can contain resource tags.

CanOrderBy.description: Can this column be used for sorting?

Name.description:
Unique identity of this column (in this particular context); the name to be used when requesting the column from a provider,
setting restrictions or order by criteria

CanRestrictBy.description: Can this column be used as a restriction

RestrictionType.description: The data type of the restriction; use this to retrieve the legal operators for the restriction

RestrictionListName.description: If the restriction data type is 'list', this property contains the name of the SoList so that choices can be shown

IsVisible.description: Is this column visible to the user in configuration dialogs etc

ExtraInfo.description: Example: "navigator" -> Should this column be mapped to a hyperlinked navigator text type?

Width.description:
The width specification, if the column info has been extended with GUI-based information.
It is either "n%" or "nc", where n is an integer. Percent-formatted fields grow and shrink; number-of-characters
formatted fields have constant width when the whole archive width changes.

IconHint.description:
Icon hint corresponding to the display name; this icon hint is used in the configuration dialog
and other places where we 'talk about' the columns of the archive. The actual heading
of the archive may also contain icons in lieu of textual names, the icon hint for that
is specified in {SuperOffice.CRM.ArchiveLists.ArchiveColumnInfo.HeadingIconHint} and is a different one.

HeadingIconHint.description:
Icon hint for the archive heading only. If this is a nonempty string, the archive header
should use this icon and ignore the {SuperOffice.CRM.ArchiveLists.ArchiveColumnInfo.DisplayName}. Otherwise, the DisplayName
should be used as the heading.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.WorkflowGoal.description:

Services for the WorkflowGoal Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

RestrictionGroups.description: The restrictions (can be multiple groups) that make up the Workflow goal criteria

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

Workflow filter carrier

Services for the WorkflowFilter Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

Info about workflow content like messages, forms and links.
<para />
Carrier object for WorkflowContentInfo.
Services for the WorkflowContentInfo Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

Id.description: The id of the content row.

Actions.description: True if the content (form, link) have associated actions.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.VisibleFor.description:
Carrier object for VisibleFor.
Services for the VisibleFor Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ISentryAgent">Sentry Agent</see>.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.WorkflowC.description: TryAddPersonsToEmailFlow: Try to add a participant to the EmailFlow. Same function available in PersonAgent
RemoveParticipantsFromEmailFlow: Remove participants (actually workflow instances) from the workflow
CreateEmailFlowContent: Create content to an email flow
ConnectEmailFlowContent: Link any SMessage to the email flow. The SMessage (and any related SShipment etc) should probably not be used/visible elsewhere.
CopyEmailFlowContent: Copy smessage and connected shipment to the email flow. The SMessage (and any related SShipment etc) should probably not be used/visible elsewhere.
UpdateFormSubmissions: Attempt to update stored field values for up to the given number of form submissions
SetStatusOnWorkflow: Set status on workflow, Run or pause flow

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.WorkflowEvent.description:
Workflow event carrier
<para />
Carrier object for WorkflowEvent.
Services for the WorkflowEvent Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.WorkflowC.description: SendEvent: Send a workflow event. Most event signaling will finish very quickly as they normally just change the state of a workflow instance

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.WorkflowEventRe.description:
Workflow event result carrier
<para />
Carrier object for WorkflowEventResult.
Services for the WorkflowEventResult Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.WorkflowC.description: AddAfterWorkflowStep: Add another step (and any of its substeps) after the given step id (which must exist), and move any following steps in the workflow further down the line.
CreateDefaultWorkflowStepFromType: Creates a new carrier from the step type given, with the right kind of properties, defaults set.
CreateDefaultWorkflowStepOptionFromType: Creates a new carrier from the option type given, with the right kind of properties, defaults set.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.WorkflowStepOpt.description:
Workflow step split option carrier base carrier class.
<para />
Carrier object for WorkflowStepOptionBase.
Services for the WorkflowStepOptionBase Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

WorkflowStepId.description: The workflow step this instance belongs to

Steps.description: The steps to execute if this option/path is selected

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.WorkflowWaitFor.description:
Workflow action info carrier
<para />
Carrier object for WorkflowWaitForAction.
Services for the WorkflowWaitForAction Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IWorkflowAgent">Workflow Agent</see>.

WorkflowStepId.description: The workflow step this instance belongs to

RestrictionGroups.description: The restrictions (can be multiple groups) that make up the Workflow action criteria

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.

externalDocs.description: The SuperOffice DevNet Community has more documentation, examples, and discussion forums.
